docs.name: Vocat API
docs.info: Vocat is a teaching and learning platform that facilitates qualitative and quantitative assessment of a range of media. Built as a collaboration between the Center for Teaching and Learning at Baruch College, City University of New York and Cast Iron Coding of Portland, Oregon, the tool is in active development.
docs.copyright: Copyright 2015 Baruch College, City University of New York

resources.name: Evaluations
resources.full_description: Evaluations are created by users for submissions. There can only be one evaluation for each submission/evaluator combination. An evaluation is owned by the user who creates it. The actual score fields in evaluations are dependent on what rubric is used, and these values are accordingly stored in a flexible HSTORE field type.

methods.name: index

apis.short_description: returns all visible evaluations for a given submission

methods.full_description: This endpoint returns only those evaluations that are visible to the authenticated user. Furthermore, the authenticated user must have read access to the submission. Evaluators can see all evaluations for submissions within their courses. Creators can see all published evaluations on submissions they own. Peers can only see their own evaluations. Note that the exact fields returned in the response are dependent on what rubric is being used for the submission project.

errors.description: The current user does not have read access to this submission.

examples:
